text:
David Golomb (‎; 4 February 1933 – 27 June 2019) was an Israeli politician. He served two terms as a member of the Knesset from 1968 to 1969, and again from 1977 to 1981. He was a member of four parties (Alignment, Labor Party, Democratic Movement for Change and Shinui) during his time in the Knesset.
Golomb was born in Tel Aviv. He was married to Miriam (who died in 2002), and had three children. He died on 27 June 2019, at the age of 86.
